title: 6L Live PlmCasX Expression & Purification

groups.title: The Center for Genome Editing and Recording

request.title: The Center for Genome Editing and Recording

source.description: Set up pre-culture by either transforming plasmid into Rosetta cells or using a small amount from a glycerol stock (steps found below).

source.body: Perform all steps aseptically, next to a Bunsen burner.

cases.title: Set up pre-culture (transform plasmid)
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9shdt","text":"Aseptically transform plasmid into competent Rosetta cells ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ta8a","text":"Thaw 10 μl competent Rosetta cells on ice, flick tube to mix","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j519","text":"Add 1 μl ~200 μM plasmid to cells and rest on ice for 5 – 10 minutes","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"517mh","text":"Heat shock cells in 42 °C water bath for 35 – 45 seconds","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1sbfm","text":"Add 300 μl room temperature Luria-Bertani (LB) broth to tube and rest on ice for 2 minutes","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6p5l","text":"Shake cells at 37 °C, 160 – 180 rpm for 1 hour","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Set up pre-culture (take stab from glycerol stock)
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8crsl","text":"Aseptically take a small amount of the glycerol stock and place directly into 300 μl Luria-Bertani (LB) broth","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mbt6","text":"Shake cells at 37 °C, 160 – 180 rpm for 1 hour","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

source.body: Be sure to blank spectrophotometer with cuvette of clean media.

source.description:

.

to each flask (
IPTG per flask).

Shake at

Transfer cultures to 1L plastic centrifuge tubes and balance pairs of tubes by adding MilliQ H2O.

source.body: Use blue sleeves to ensure tubes fit snuggly.

source.description: Pour off supernatant from cultures.

Add
Lysis Buffer + TCEP to each plastic tube.
Vortex tubes until sample is homogenous.

source.body: Use a flat-top vortex.

source.description: Transfer cell suspension to a 500 ml beaker.

source.body: Alternatively, lysed cells can be frozen down for later use. Transfer to 5mL tubes and centrifuge at 4,000rpm, 20 minutes, 4°C. Pour off supernatant and freeze pellet at -20°C.

source.description: Add solution of tablets + PMSF + DNase to cell suspension.
Place sample in tube of ice with water to hold beaker snugly.
Sonicate sample in cold room.
Rinse tip of sonicator with ethanol, then H2O.

Set sonicator to run at 5.5 power setting for
, cycling between
and
.

Place 6 plastic ultracentrifuge tubes (with caps)
.
Divide sonicated sample between ultracentrifuge tubes. Use scale to match pairs within +/- 0.01 g by adding MilliQ H2O.

Centrifuge samples in Beckman Coulter Avanti J-E centrifuge at
,
,
.

Filter sonicated sample through bottle top 0.22 μm filter and store
.

Add
Qiagen Ni-NTA resin to yellow gravity column (Econo-Column Chromatography Column) with butterfly valve in
cold room.
Drain off ethanol storage buffer.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP. (Repeat 4 more times).

Add
Lysis Buffer + TCEP to Ni-NTA column, mix with pipette.
Transfer Ni-NTA resin to bottle with sonicated/filtered sample and add stir bar.

source.body: Do not discard yellow gravity column, it will be used again in step 33.

source.description:
Stir sample in Ni-NTA resin at
for at least
.
Add sample in Ni-NTA resin back to yellow gravity column.
Drain liquid.

source.body: Collect flow-through for gel electrophoresis.

source.description:
Add
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.
Drain liquid.

source.body: Collect flow-through for gel electrophoresis.

source.description:
Add
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Add
TEV protease (4 eppendorfs of
lab stock).
Mix sample in Ni-NTA resin well.

Incubate column at
,
.

Elute Ni-NTA column into 50 ml Falcon tube. Keep
. Label as “flow-through.”

Wash column with
Elution Buffer (
). (Repeat this step 2 more times). Collect samples into 50 ml Falcon tubes and label with Elution numbers (I.e. label elution #1 this step, elution #2 next, etc.).

Wash column with
Elution Buffer (
).

Wash column with
Elution Buffer (
).

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.
Pool fractions into 15 ml 50 kDa MWCO Amicon Concentrators.

Centrifuge at
,
until volume is less than
.
Transfer to 4 ml 30 kDa MWCO Amicon Concentrator.

Centrifuge until volume is less than
.

Equilibrate column with
IEX A Buffer.

source.body: Run 5 – 10 Column Volumes at 1 – 5 ml/min, using pre-column pressure alarm set to 0.5 MPa.

source.description: Run Äkta at 0.25 ml/min to detach column.

Draw up
sample with a 1 ml syringe.
Attach threaded luer lock attachment and remove air from syringe.
Insert new 96 deep well plate into position 3.
Run SP column gradient program between IEX Buffer A and B to elute.
Collect fractions from chromatogram peak. Concentrate fractions if necessary.

source.body: Save samples for gel electrophoresis.

source.description: Run Äkta at 0.25 ml/min to attached S200 10/300 increase column.

source.body: Use 24 ml column, run at 0.5 ml/min, with 2.8 MPa pre-column pressure.

source.description: Manually inject sample into top of 5 ml SP column.

source.body: Use wet connections and don’t exceed 5 ml/min.

source.description: Run Äkta at 0.25 ml/min to attach column.

Add
loop to Äkta.

Inject
SEC Buffer into loop with 5 ml syringe with the red luer lock attachment.
Draw up sample into 1 ml syringe with the red luer lock attachment.

Inject sample (which should be less than
) into loop, leaving syringe attached.
Run SEC program. The sample should be injected from the loop.

source.body: In System Control on the Akta software, go to the menu bar at the top of the page, select Method Editor > New. Under column type, select Gel Filtration. Choose ‘Superdex 200 10/300 Increase’ for the Column type.

source.description: Collect fractions from chromatogram. Concentrate as necessary.

source.body: Save samples for gel.

source.description: In a separate beaker, mix together the following reagents:

Add
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.
Add 8 tablets of ROCHE cOmplete tablets (1 tablet per 20 ml).

Add PMSF to final concentration
(
of
stock PMSF).

Add
RNase-free DNase (2 μl per 20 ml).
Add solution of tablets + PMSF + DNase to cell suspension.
Place sample in tube of ice with water to hold beaker snuggly.
Sonicate sample in cold room.
Rinse tip of sonicator with ethanol, then H2O.

Set sonicator to run at 5.5 power setting for
, cycling between
and
.

Place 6 plastic ultracentrifuge tubes (with caps)
.
Divide sonicated sample between ultracentrifuge tubes. Use scale to match pairs within +/- 0.01 g by adding MilliQ H2O.

Centrifuge samples in Beckman Coulter Avanti J-E centrifuge at
,
,
.

Filter sonicated sample through bottle top 0.22 μm filter and store
.

Add
Qiagen Ni-NTA resin to yellow gravity column with butterfly valve in
cold room.
Drain off ethanol storage buffer.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP. (Repeat 4 more times).

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Wash with
Lysis Buffer + TCEP.

Add
Lysis Buffer + TCEP to Ni-NTA column, mix with pipette.
Transfer Ni-NTA resin to bottle with sonicated/filtered sample and add stir bar.

source.body: Do not discard yellow gravity column, it will be used again in step 33.

Add

Add TEV protease (4 eppendorfs of high conc. lab stock).

Incubate column at

source.body: Use a 5 ml SP Column, Screw the bottom of column into top Äkta port, making sure to use wet connections. Use pre-column pressure alarm set at 0.5 MPa.

source.description:
Equilibrate column with
IEX A Buffer.

Draw up
sample with a 1 ml syringe.
Attach threaded luer lock attachment and remove air from syringe.
Manually inject sample into top of 5 ml SP column.

source.body: Use wet connections and don’t exceed 5 ml/min.

source.description: Nanodrop protein amount.
Aliquot into tubes.

Flash freeze in liquid nitrogen and store at
.
Prepare Lysis Buffer + TCEP (final volume 160mL):

source.body:
The recipe for Lysis Buffer per 20mL of volume is:
1 Roche cOmplete protease inhibitor tablet
2uL DNase (RNase free)
0.5mM PMSF final concentration

source.description: Add 8 Roche cOmplete protease inhibitor tablets.

Add
DNase (RNase free).

Add PMSF to a final concentration of
(
of
stock PMSF).

Add TCEP to a final concentration of
(
of
stock TCEP).
Prepare IEX Buffer A, using MilliQ water as solvent:

Add
HEPES (
).

Add
NaCl.

Add
glycerol.

Add TCEP to final concentration
.
Prepare IEX Buffer B, using MilliQ water as solvent:

Add
HEPES (
).

Add
NaCl.

Add
glycerol.

Add TCEP to final concentration
.
Run Äkta at 0.25 ml/min to attach column.

source.body: Use a 5 ml SP Column, Screw the bottom of column into top Äkta port, making sure to use wet connections. Use pre-column pressure alarm set at 0.5 MPa.

source.description: Fill to final volume of 160mL using MilliQ water.

materials.name: Corning® 150 mL Bottle Top Vacuum Filter 0.22 µm Pore 13.6cm² PES
Misonix Inc S-3000 Misonix Sonicator 3000 Ultrasonic Cell Disruptor with Temperature Control

description: This protocol describes methods to express and purify PlmCasX plasmids.
